channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The hedge from Number 70 that overhangs the pavement opposite Longlands Park entrance, 8th December
item.description:
75% of the pavement cannot be used as the hedge is overgrown causing pedestrians to walk on the road. I have seen numerous school children forced into the road as the hedge has been left to overgrow the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 34 Linworth Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branch / hedge obstructing road, 7th December
item.description:
There is a large part of the hedge which has come down in the current bad weather and is across the whole of the westbound side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Bamfurlong Lane, Cheltenham

item.title: New trees, 7th December
item.description:
The new sapling trees which have been planted in the Elm Farm recreation ground in Springbank Road are far too close together. It's a lovely gesture but unless they are given far more space each, they will never thrive. Use existing trees as a guide on distance apart.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 REDWOOD, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At least 50 empty beer cans in undergrowth on footpath between Marsland Rd and Dunster Road, 7th December
item.description:
The undergrowth needs compmetely clearing away as it has become a rubbish dumping area from one end to the other. The undergrowth creates some nice holes for kids to hide and drink in out of the weather

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18 Rushworth Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken works, 6th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lower Court Farm Church Road, Staverton

item.title: Elmbridge Court roundabout road markings and on road signage, 6th December
item.description:
Urgent. There has been three accidents in the past week and another today. The road markings and road signs have worn so badly they cannot be seen very clearly in the dark and virtually invisible when wet and that’s in the day. The lanes are so important to this roundabout with its hamburger flyover we are shocked this has not been dealt with before the winter. The Lane lines and road signage needs to be repainted immediately, please look into this urgently. I could not take photos as it’s too dangerous. I have sent this to my MP to follow up as a matter of safety urgency. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elm Bridge Court, Longlevens
Report on FixMyStreet
